name: European Central Securities Depositories Association
legal: International non-profit association, established under Belgian law (aisbl)
membership: ECSDA cooperates on an informal basis with four other regional CSD associations through the World Forum of CSDs (WFC).
memberOrga:
The list of ECSDA member organisations is available at:
http://ecsda.eu/about/members
goal:
ECSDA represents 40 national and international central securities depositories (CSDs) across 35 European countries.

The association provides a forum for European CSDs to exchange views and take forward projects of mutual interest. It also aims to promote a constructive dialogue between the CSD community, European public authorities and all other stakeholders looking to achieve an optimal regulatory framework for clearing and settlement.
interests: Banking and financial services, Economy, finance and the euro, Institutional affairs, Single market
euInitiatives:
CSD Regulation
MiFID II, MiFIR,
EMIR
Shareholder Rights Review
UCITS V
AIFMD
Securities laws
Future of Post-trade
FinTech
